com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step

Interface Cache


  • public interface Cache
    The interface to be used to create/modify/delete a persistent global key/value datastore for use by an SDK step. The cache is managed by Aperture Data Studio, but can only be deleted or refreshed by the custom step. The cache is specific to a specific class of step, and is not visible or reusable by any other step class. The key/value datastore is fast enough on reads to be used for random access lookups.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the cache.
      void delete()
      Deletes the cache.
      long getCreateTime()
      Gets the time when the cache was created.
      long getModifiedTime()
      Gets the time when the cache was last modified.
      boolean isValid()
      Checks whether the cache is valid, i.e.
      String read(String key)
      Reads a string value from the cache according to the key given.
      void write(String key, String value)
      Writes a value string to the cache keyed by the given key string.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
    throws Exception
        Closes the cache. Should be called when all read/writes are completed - typically in StepOutput.close().
        Throws:
        Exception - throws when cache is in use and cannot be closed

      • delete

        void delete()
     throws Exception
        Deletes the cache.
        Throws:
        Exception - Will throw an exception if in use.

      • read

        String read(String key)
     throws Exception
        Reads a string value from the cache according to the key given. If the key is not found in the cache it will return null.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object to be found.
        Returns:
        The string value.
        Throws:
        Exception - Occurs if there is an error accessing the backing database.

      • write

        void write(String key,
           String value)
    throws Exception
        Writes a value string to the cache keyed by the given key string. If the key is already present, the old value will be replaced with the new value.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object to store
        value - The string value
        Throws:
        Exception - Occurs if there is an error accessing the backing database.

      • getCreateTime

        long getCreateTime()
        Gets the time when the cache was created.
        Returns:
        create time in milliseconds

      • getModifiedTime

        long getModifiedTime()
        Gets the time when the cache was last modified.
        Returns:
        modify time in milliseconds

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Checks whether the cache is valid, i.e. still has backing files
        Returns:
        true if the cache is valid, false otherwise
